# alicloud\_instance\_keywords

Operation to query the reserved keywords of an ApsaraDB RDS instance. The reserved keywords cannot be used for the usernames of accounts or the names of databases.

-> **NOTE:** Available in v1.196.0+

## Example Usage

```typescript
import * as constructs from "constructs";
import * as cdktf from "cdktf";
/*Provider bindings are generated by running cdktf get.
See https://cdk.tf/provider-generation for more details.*/
import * as alicloud from "./.gen/providers/alicloud";
class MyConvertedCode extends cdktf.TerraformStack {
  constructor(scope: constructs.Construct, name: string) {
    super(scope, name);
    const dataAlicloudInstanceKeywordsResources =
      new alicloud.dataAlicloudInstanceKeywords.DataAlicloudInstanceKeywords(
        this,
        "resources",
        {
          key: "account",
          outputFile: "./classes.txt",
        }
      );
    new cdktf.TerraformOutput(this, "account_keywords", {
      value: cdktf.propertyAccess(
        dataAlicloudInstanceKeywordsResources.keywords,
        ["0"]
      ),
    });
  }
}

```

## Argument Reference

The following arguments are supported:

* `key` - (Required, ForceNew) The type of reserved keyword to query. Valid values: `account`, `database`.
* `outputFile` - (Optional) File name where to save data source results (after running `terraform apply`).

## Attributes Reference

The following attributes are exported in addition to the arguments listed above:

* `ids` - A list of keywords.
* `keywords` - An array that consists of reserved keywords.
